text: Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Bardzo owocowe, bretty tylko to podbijają. Przyjemna kwasowość. Świetne!

Alaranjada de média turbidez, espuma branca de aspecto cremoso, boa formação e persistência. Brett evidente e bem dosado, sem muitas nuances mas prazeroso, celeiro, couro de sapato novo, residual alaranjado. Paladar de médio amargor e leve dulçor, bem eqiilibrado e dosado. Corpo médio e alta carbonatação. Final de amargor crescente, mais cítrico porém com a brett sempre em evidência. Muito boa!

1 of 6 in an Evil Twin Femme Fatale tasting event with Eric of Windsor Hy-Vee. Pours a pretty straw yellow, crystal clarity, nice and carbonated, two fingers of bubbly head. Soapy nose, intensely piney flavor.
Bottle. Citrus yellow pour with white head. Funky citrus, Brett and tart aromas. Herbal, citrus, Brett and funky sweet Flavors.
Pours a nice cola colored brown. Aromas of malts, fruit, and a touch of spice. Has flavors of chocolate, caramel, and a touch of wood that finishes with some nice Brettlike notes.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2016 Bottle. Moderate grain and hay for the malt, light grass and herbs for the hops, moderate barnyard and musty for the yeast, with notes of clove, coriander, pear and pepper. Head is large, frothy, white with fair lacing and is mostly lasting. Color is murky medium amber. Flavor starts faintly sweet and moderately to heavily acidic, then finishes moderately acidic and bitter. Palate is on the lighter side of medium, and the texture is hidden by the very fizzy carbonation. Great mix and balance between malt, yeast and hops in this tasty Belgian Ale.

APPEARANCE- looks bright in my glass, foamy white head, a bit turbid.
NOSE- slightly sour, perhaps like a saison.
FLAVOR- very unique, and indeed funky. Slightly sour, yet has an additional flavor that i cant put my finger on. That must be the Brett coming through.

Bottle to IPA glass
Consummation: Great brett lemon 
Adjunct: Honey sweet aroma, HUGE bright white foamy head, funky.

I cant really say how old this bottle is, but i figured..hey i like brett so itll be ok. It was extremely one dimensional brett bomb. Really lacking anything that could make it an ipa, but maybe that was all gone by now.
Orval clone. Well done. Brett, funky, citrus aroma, dry finish, and slightly tart. Enjoyable beer that I would highly recommend to Orval lovers.

22oz bottle at home.

First Brett IPA...and not sure I am a fan.

Very funky and tart.

Used cheap bubblegum after taste....

Glad I tried it - but wont seek it out again.
Balanced between lemon and grapefruit citrus notes, sourness and funk. Some tartness creeps in late with a hint of barnyard, medium hop presence. A strange but innovative blend.

500ml botle. Light hazy golden orange color with white head. Yeasty aroma, spicy, citrusy fruity, funky, bretty, dusty, wood. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Draught at Deep Ellum, 9/4/15.White gold, ultra-pale body topped by a small but dense white head that slowly recedes to cover. Moderate haziness.Very tart, floral/perfumey brett notes in the nose (suprise) are wedded pretty nicely with light tropical fruits (dry pineapple, guava) and hints of pear, orangeskin and heavy lemon balm/lemon oil. Malts seem cracker-like, and quite free from any doughiness, really preserving the levity/headiness of the nose. No alcohol or flaws.Where the fatale blanc was bogged down by the oily, overly dominant wine barrel and lower, looser carbonation, this version really shines with clear lime/pear/lemon brett notes and a dry grain character adding cracker/biscuit notes and light malt adding light honey to match the acidity of the finish. Hops complement/augment the brett notes, for a change, instead of detracting/distracting and theres no oak tannin or resin or heavy breadiness. Good stuff. Maybe just a touch too much perfumey/floral dryness exacerbating the dry, crackery malts, but it certainly is light and drinkable.

Served on tap at Ox Cart. Orange lemon hold aroma. Hazy yellow orange color. Medium light body. Lemon citrus flavor. Easy drinking.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sooo good. Bottle from Bottle Caps. Pours clear golden lots of foamy head and some spotty lacing. Nose is tart fruit and dough. Flavours of lemon, citrus, dough, hint of grapefruit. Flavours are medium bitter, light sweet, light/medium tart. Full sticky body lively carbonation. Nice beer.
Strange blend of flavor with the hop combo and Brett content... Would have again under certain circumstances

651 ml. bottle. Pours a thick, well retained, fluffy white head, over a very slightly hazy, gold (SRM 5) body......nose is pine, resin, from the hops, horse blanket, barnyard funk from the Brett, light cereal notes from the malts......taste is dry, with light base malts, slight sour tartness and heavy barnyard funk from the Brett, finishing with moderate pine, resin bitterness.....mouth feel, medium body, minimal alcohol, creamy carbonation. This is a well done rendition of a Belgian/Brett Ale. The aromas and flavors are quite good, with the Brettanomyces being dominant. This should be listed as a Sour/Wild Ale. BJCP 9/3/16/4/8

Dégustée avec Mademoiselle Irina. La bière est jaune paille, trouble et très mousseuse, dune mousse onctueuse et persistante. Au nez on retrouve de la Brett, une touche dalcool, un sucre, du gazon et quelque chose qui me rappelle lair salin. En bouche, cest le houblon qui domine. Les saveurs sont citronnées et boisées. Cest puissant et agressif sans être ni ordonné ni structuré. Le tout laisse la bouche pâteuse et prend une éternité à sestomper dans une amertume fatiguante.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Tap. Hazy golden with two finger head. Really nice Brett aroma. Quite funky, but not quite as fruity ad some beet beers. Light bitterness from the hops.
Tap at El Bait Shop. Hazy light orange pour with a frothy white head. Soft, somewhat earthy, woody, dryness. Brett funk. Easy drinking. Very good.

(bottle - 22 oz) Cloudy orange pour with a fizzy white head. Slightly fruity aroma with some citrusy hops and a light tartness underneath. Very tangy at the start with a lot of sharp hop notes. Bitter and lingering middle with just a touch of brett bitter and sour.

Appearance: this beer is a hazy light gold color with a medium white head
Aroma: spicy, lemon, pepper, citrus 
Taste: strong bitterness, hints of wildness, spicy, 
Palate: lively carbonation, light mouthfeel, bitter aftertaste 
Overall: a lot less sour and tart than I thought, bitterness is the dominant sense, pretty good,

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

they call this one an ipa, but i feel like it is more like a belgium style double. slightly yeasty and tart. almost has a sour presence as well. a nice balance though makes me really like this one in its style. pours cloudy orange with a thick white head. 2 fingers high. had at my condo in myrtle beach.

This beer pours a slightly hazy golden with a small white head, and the aroma blends lemony citrus, light malts, Brett funk, and earthiness. The taste is mildly sour, slightly bitter, and a touch sweet with funk flavors dominating the aftertaste even though they are present throughout. The palate fuses a soft carbonation, medium body, and a slick texture.

Pours a slightly hazy golden yellow from the bomber with fluffy off-white head that leaves good lace. Aroma of sweet citrus over a hint of funky earth, hint of grass. Taste is more toward the citrus and caramel malt, the brett is hidden behind. A bit old, but nice and well balanced, good bitterness, a nice brett IPA.
Excellent brett ipa, right amount of balance between hops and the brett yeast. Would expect it to be higher than 6% but Im good with it. Great beer.

On draft in a snifter, nice aroma of dusty yeast and citrusy hops, with good pale malt backbone - like a Danish Orval without the mystique, which is quite a compliment. Clean even finish with a lingering bitterness and just enough brett to be present without becoming over-tart.

Bottle. Super murky bronze, not atypical for the style but not an attractive beer. Big hop and brett trois nose -- pineapple and tropical fruit. Taste is a bit sweet/cloying as some 100% Brett IPAs can be. Dries out on the finish with a little funk. Could use a little more life on the palate. Lacks some balance but overall pretty good.
Bone dry with moderate Brett funk. Its good, but a little flat as there isnt much else going on. Hops are almost indiscernable. The Sudachi version is much better.

4 oz pour on draft at B Side. Clear golden orange with off-white head. Aromas of big juicy tropical, citrus, stone fruits along with light floral and Brett. Tastes of big tropical and stone fruit, floral, Brett and funk, black peppery spice. Medium body with a very dry finish.
Cloudy pour with white head. Brett funk, citrus peels, , touches of yeast funk. Drying mouthfeel with an abrupt bitter finish. Pretty good.

Pours clear amber with a thick and rather persistent eggshell head. Strong aroma has hoppy, grapefruit and butterscotch tones. Flavor is quite hoppy, very like an IPA, evergreen and bitter wood hopping (ahem!) all over the palate, accompanied by grapefruit and butterscotch tones. Smooth texture has a woody fizz that leaves a hoppy finish and a somewhat persistent tingle. Let this one seduce you!

Botlle: golden orange color withplnty of white, well-sustained head. It smells of grapefruit, buttery funk, lemon, honey. It tastes piney and resinous, a bit metallic, with a touch of tartness. Acidic and esthery, a bit of aspirin-like bitterness. Its initially full-medium bodied but thins a little as it warms. The hoppyness blends very well with the tart funkyness in this one. Very well balanced.

Old rating rerated 09.12.2014, 0,65l bottle @ home:
Big creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly fresh fruity, leafs, light malts, sugar, dried fruits, hops, hay, caramel, mild brett, lawn. Taste is slightly harsh floral, leafs, flowers, harsh mild brett, hay, lawn, hops, citrus peel, dried fruits, bark, caramel, hints of paper. Longlasting bitterness, slightly harsh mouthfeel. Fair enough.

a Belgian IPA brewed with brett. Yeast; cloudy gold color with a thick tan head; citrusy, hoppy aroma; great citrusy hop flavor on a light malt background with mild sour brett yeast notes; dry, bitter, slightly sour finish; an excellent beer

"forgot this was an IPA and not just a brett beer, till I smelled it. Wonderful earthy, funky, bright and vinrantly hoppy aroma and flavor. Smooth and dry on the palate. Citrus and hay, lemons and barnyard funk. Cant remember what this cost, but I hope to get it again. #3800!!"

Hazy yellow orange in color... Aroma of brett, dry funk, light citrus... Flavor is dry brett funk, grains, horse blanket, citrus and earthy hops... Bitter throughout... Solid

Bottled sample from Blumonk in Buffalo NY. Pours hazy yellow. Medium head. Smells fruity. Taste of hops spice toffee(?). Delicious

22 oz bottle courtesy of JB, served in a stem glass. Pours hazy golden with a large, fluffy white head that fades slowly to a thin cover and leaves a moderate amount of loose lace. The nose has big notes of lemon and tart fruit, combined with resin, Brett funk, earth, grass and flowers. The flavour is balanced between slightly tart fruity notes on the one hand, and piney, resinous hops on the other. Lightly sweet pale malts come through as well with a touch of honey. The finish is long and hoppy with funk. On the palate it is medium in body with a smooth, creamy texture and average carbonation. Overall, a nice, dry bretted IPA. 2014-09-10

Bottle from Total Wine. Cloudy deep golden pour with a rocky white head. Aroma is fruit skins, Brett funk, sourdough, yogurt and a note of citrus. Bold, bitter hoppy flavor,with underlying tropical fruit, citrus peels, sourdough, touches of yeast funk. Drying mouthfeel with an abrupt bitter finish. Pretty nice.

A light golden straw color with a bit of white head that sits on the surface. Smells of spicy Brett character, horse blanket, coriander, tropical and citrus fruit, black pepper. Taste is spicy barnyard, pepper, citrus, tangerine, piney and citrus hops, ends with a good cracker like caramel malt and some hops. Good Brett beer overall, drinkable and refreshing.

Bottle from mane liquor. Cheers El. Pours a golden orange with a thick white head. Nose is citrus, yeast, herbal tones and a shit loads of Brett. Taste is juicy citrus and grapefruit with a wack of Belgium yeast and Brett coming through. So balanced. Getting the hops from the ipa and subtle sour notes from the Brett. Great farmhouse ipa.

Bottle: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Exploding airy creme foamy head on top of a hazy to murky yellow colored beer.
Aromas of flowers, nettle, some fruits, honey, herbs, yeast, some unfermented sugars and carbo gass.

text: Bottle. Pours yellow with a creamy finger thick head. Aroma is light toffee malts with citrusy hops, as well as fruity whiffs of tropical peach and some brett. Flavour is bitter with spicy citrusy lemon peel hops, as well as some sweet toffee malts. Nice bitter finish, but a bit too soft on the funk.
Draft - Grapefruit, tropical fruit with a bit of yeast. Cloudy gold with a decent white head. Pithy, grapefruit and a nice Brett estery finish.

Shared bomber poured to snifters, showing a hazed, orangey gold color, with a modest, diminishing layer of soft white, head foam, and dots & dashes of lacing. The nose was quite floral, with spice, overly ripened fruit, and yeasty funk blended in. Light to medium bodied, with carbonation that seemed a bit overly effervescent & sudsy. A pronounced, and very lasting, earthy & rindy hop bitterness dominated the flavor, which also added some tartness, and an intriguing touch of sweetness that lingered on the tongue throughout the taste, and continued into the finish with the bitterness, and some accompanying dryness. The esters disappointed, but otherwise, not bad.
Rocket City Brewfest, milky yellow with white head. A: mango, pepper, pear. T: mango fruity, pear. Medium body with a balanced finish.
Golden with a small white head. Fruity and spicy tones. Fruit, spices and a sour bitterness. <medium body with a bitter / sour finish.

Bottle. Pour is murky gold, with a fluffy / chunky white head into this glass. It retains well, with light spotting presence. The nose is bready malts, pineapple, lemongrass, citrus hops, moving to a funky, as expected. The flavor profile is initial bittering hops featuring citrus rind and pineapple presence, moving to grass, peppery spice, with a sweet undertone and mild funk presence. I am a fan of this one for sure -

@ Party Town / Florence KY --- Clear light amber with a 4" frothy head that stays awhile, and lace everywhere. Aroma is citrus and grass. Taste varies - on a sip there is immediately a strong citrus hop presence, but on a big swallow, there is sweet malt and hay, and very light spices, that becomes bolder in the palate, then allowing some citrus hop flavor in on the finish, but not enough to take over. Overall, quite good, satisfying. Recommended.

22oz bomber. Cloudy golden yellow with a massive frothy, rocky, white cap and heavy lacing. Aroma of straw, wet attic, citrus, tropical fruit. Taste is sweet with a gentle bitterness. Medium-high carbonation and a slightly chalky mouthfeel that evens out to a crispiness.

El color es dorado y turbio con densa espuma blanca. El aroma es cítrico con un toque equilibrado de brett. Cuerpo medio, el sabor es intenso y combina el cítrico con brett. que se extiende hasta el final seco. Muy rico.

Pours golden and clear. Aroma of bread, hay, and some mild citrus and pine. Taste was bready and a little funky. Sweet and bitter mixed togehter. Wasnt a fan. Im not terribly fond of Belgians as it is. When I bought this the front of the bottle said India Pale Ale underneath Brett. Id never seen it before so gave it a shot. I was shocked when I drank it expecting a nice IPA. Very weird they list IPA on the label and I come on here and see its a Belgian.

Aroma is citrus, clove and grassiness. Taste is a sweet maltiness which is consumed by a fairly potent bitterness that leaves a tarty bitterness. Body is a hazy gold with a thin lace head that retains well.
Shared bottle, poured a cloudy orange colour with a huge white head, citrus, spiced Brett notes. Orange, coriander?, hop bitterness, tropical fruits, peach, some malt notes. Lovely taste

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2014 Bottle, gift from my sister-in-law. Pours a light orange honey with a big frothy head. Aroma is weed, hops, citrus, floral. Taste is bitter rinds and yeast. Dry and crisp. Very bitter and little malt to speak of. Pine tar Brett would be pleased.
Pours a clearish golden yellow, nice white head and lace. Hay, grass hop, light barnyard in the nose. Taste is bready, really clear but light hops, hay, zesty lemons, Brett.

Appearance: Cloudy orange golden color with a thick white head. Good lacing.Aroma: Citrus, yeast and fruity.Palate: Medium to full body. Tad sweet, and a fresh bitterness. Average carbonation.Taste: Citrus hoppy. Balanced fruity and a fresh yeast influence.Overall impression: What a lovely tasty and fresh ale.Personal stats: Bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika in Oslo, Norway

Bottle. In aroma nice belgian funky notes, some fruits (peaches, citrus) and floral hints. The beer is little hazy, pale golden, small head. In taste citrus fruits, belgian yeasts notes, grapefruit bitter finish. The beer is light bodied, fizzy carbonation. Very nice, delicious beer, could make use of more bretts.
Des fruits exotiques savonneux et cuirés dans une ipa qui est désormais un classique dans le genre. Buvabilité fantasque.

There's a hint if orange behind the hops that makes the flavor more complex. I like it.

22oz from shelf. Poured carefully as to not disturbe the sediment although the beer is still a cloudy orange. Aromas of citrus and funk. Taste is semi dry and bitter. Flavors of flower petal grindings and musty basement chants. Ancient religions crafted with chunks of ebony. Bitter cobwebs. Very nice. Not a gimmick at all. Finishes pretty dry with a daedric brett presence. All hail the night mother.

Refrigerated brown bomber, thanks to BMart, poured into a tulip. Pours hazy golden with big white head. Aroma is yeasty/tart, medium body, well carbonated, and thick small bubble lacing. Taste is yeasty, herbal hops, hints of brett, and bitter finish. Part belgian ale and part IPA with hints of brett which dont meld for me.

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika. Golden color, good foam. Immediate hoppy aromas, brett, citrus; medium aroma intensity- also some fruitiness. Medium body & complexity. Good bitterness , some sournes: balances well. Very enjoyable

65cl bottle shared by Arve_Christian - thanks! Pours slightly hazy golden with a white head. Fruity aroma with notes of clementine, tropical fruits and some lightly yeasty notes. Moderate sweet with citrusy and hoppy note s and a pleasant bitterness. Nice one!

Had with Posey on brew day. Pours a hazy yellow with three fingers of fluffy white head. Aroma is floral spicy and yeasty. Also citrus and lemongrass. Flavor follows and is fairly bitter. Nice clean finish. Medium to light bodied.
Gul uklar, ser nesten ut son den har skilt seg. skummet er høyt og fluffy. Sydhavsfrukter og humle i lukten. Bitter humlesmak, savner sødmen fra sydhavsfruktene i lukten. lang ettersmak
Korngul, tåkete med tynt hvitt skum. Aroma av grape, sitrus. Syrlig smak med god litt besk ettersmak. Medium kullsyre.
Uklar gul farge med hvitt fluffy skum. Lukter godt humle, sitrus og grapefrukt. Veldig preg av grapefrukt i smak. Også godt humlepreg og god lang bitter ettersmak.
Crazy unique beer. Lots of brett in the taste. Hops are there. Puckers you a little in the finish. Great.
Aroma & taste is all citrus with a focus on grapefruit and peach with a woody finish. Also known as, fun hoppy beer!

Bottle. Pours yellow, hazy with a big white head that stays to the end. In aroma there are some funky, spicy notes, but not only - there is of course massive aroma from american hops (grapefruit, orange mainly). In taste at first those Belgian style notes (brett part) that ends with orange, peach flavour. Medium bitterness, medium body and carbonation. Very complex and enjoyable beer.

Bottle from Vika enjoyed at home
Yellow hazy, massive frothy head. Smells of funk, spices, citrus hops, light fruits, light malts. Light sweet, quite fruity and funky, quite complex flavors, the brett has really infused the flavor profile. Medium bitter finish, resinis, Quite lively carbonation. Fantastic beer; love the combo of hops and brett

Big offwhite head. Clear yellow body with strong carbonation. Resiny
tropical fruit and spice aroma with lemony wooden funky notes. Dry,
and faintly sweet, orangey spicy wooden taste with resiny pine needle
notes. Mid-bodied. Fizzy, sharpish mouthfeel. Dry spicy wooden
orangey aftertaste with funky toffee and lime notes. Very nice, and
highly drinkable. Nice combination of funkiness with an IPA. (0.65l
bottle, from wine monopoly, Vika, Oslo.)

Clear, pale gold pour with huge pillowy, foamy head. Aroma is an explosion of tropical, fresh, juicy fruits. Some darker fruits appear in the nose after a while, but very subtly. Taste is a medium bitter, with a, pretty mild lingering finish. Texture is oily, with average carbonation.

Bomber. Starts clear pale golden yellow, finishes opaque, creamy white foam head settles and lasts. Aroma of yeasty tropical fruit. Tart fruity yeasty bretty funky taste, some farmyard and mild malts. Average carbonation, medium bodied, moderately hopped. Finishes a bit dry and lightly bitter. NFL (Not For Lagerboys)

22 ounce bottle into tulip glass, no bottle dating. Pours lightly hazy bright golden amber color with a 2-3 finger dense and fluffy white head with incredible retention, that reduces to a thick cap that lasts. Nice dense soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a large amount of streaming carbonation retaining the head. Aromas of big tangerine, pineapple, grapefruit, lemon zest, orange peel, pear, floral, grass, pepper, light pine, light funk, and floral/grassy earthiness. Incredible aromas with big bright citrus/tropical hop and brett ester notes; with great strength. Taste of big tangerine, pineapple, grapefruit, lemon zest, orange peel, pear, floral, grass, pepper, light pine, bread, light funk, and floral/grassy earthiness. Good amount of peppery yeast/floral bitterness on the finish with light tangy tartness; with lingering notes of tangerine, pineapple, grapefruit, lemon zest, orange peel, pear, floral, grass, pepper, light pine, bread, light funk, and floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice complexity of bright citrus/tropical hops and spicy/fruity brett flavors; with a great hop/yeast flavor balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium-high carbonation and medium bodied; with a very smooth, crisp, and moderately sticky/prickly mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an awesome Brett IPA. All around great balance and complexity of bright citrus/tropical hops and fruity/spicy brett flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink. A highly enjoyable offering.

Bottle. Very light amber / mostly yellow, hazy, white head. Light saison, bretty, farmhouse with some hops and tropical notes, high carbonation, moderate body, fresh, bit spicy, refreshing on finish with some tartness and a bit of booze.

Poured from an oversized bottle. Cloudy light orange colour with average off-white head, generous lacing. Aroma is funky brett, citrus, and hints of caramel malt. The flavour is more bitter than the nose would suggest, with notes of grapefruit, lemon, underripe orange, pine resin, and brett yeast. The finish is dry and bitter. Solid Brett beer.

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow orange with big white head, thin lacing. Aroma is hoppy, citrus, floral. Flavor is citrus, floral hops and brett, with a hoppy, fruity finish. A fruity, hoppy beer, was hoping for more brett character. Moderate carbonation and medium-light body.

Location/Date:Bottle split with Dave and Harris on 2/07/2014.
Appearance: Poured a yellow orange cloud. 
Aroma: Aroma of citrus, light funk yeast.
Taste: Read more like an IPA with brett...light medium bitter, lemony citrus, light funk.
Palate:Light body.
Summary: I was expecting more brett effect in this one, but Im glad(for me) it didnt have it.
hazy golden color. Dry, big bretty barnyard character. Full body. Great. Big bitter finish

Hazy mess from bottom half of bottle. Powdery, NZ hops, orange tied in with lemon merengue crust, those old school thumb sized orange vitamin C pills, ok smell. Taste is pretty good, so so harshness, minor sourness, no vinegar, lemon, odd spice. Decent.

Rating #942 - Jan 27, 2014 - #mondaynightbeers share with the crew - 750ml bottle from Co-op. Clear golden pour with a bubbly white foam that dissipates slowly. Aroma is a slam dunk of funk, great yeasty sourness and a lemony-pine sweetness from the hops. Palate is more of the same, great light yeast character, not lacking in sweetness and hop depth. Light on the malt character, but oozing with so many other interesting things - a citrusy Bretty punchbowl of awesome.

Pours an orange-yellow murky straw, with a full soapy head that leaves cascading lovely lace. A burnt bretty nose ensues. A softly-palated coriander and orange brew with plenty of brett to add to the lightly diacetyl finish. Nicely put together, this one would age well to bring out the flavors as well as they shine forth in the nose. Good job!

This keg has been sitting in my cellar for at least a year and a half. Finally, there is no IPA left on this one. This thing is amazing buttery and brett strong! Nice amber yellow in color with a huge white head! It tastes like a yeast roll with honey butter! Super smooth and delicious!

bottle shared by JM, thanks dude! pours clear bright yellow with a creamy white head, good retention and lacing. melons from outer galaxy, passionfruits, white grapes, even a white wine character along with light woodsy vanilla notes, lean maltiness - slightly spicy and husky, early stage bretts, citrus. bright to average carbonation, light body, drying bretty and grassy-spicy-citrusy finish. was hoping for a more developed bretty profile but it is still a very good balanced offering!
pours a cloudy yellow and orange with small white head leaving sticky lacing. Aroma is brett, yeast, and pepper. Thin mouthfeel with spicy yeast and light brett and light dryness. Good

Bottle shared by Jean-Michael, thanks! Pours a clear golden topped by a medium white head that leaves good lacing. Aroma is fruity and tropical: mangoes and white grapes I would say. Taste is dry with a nice floral and fruity interplay. Brettanomyces character is a bit shy at the moment. Body is light, carbonation a bit intense. Lovely!

Looks..yellow golden orange, med-lge fluffy white head. Smells..fruity hops peachy and citrus orange, bretty, some tartness and some sweet waffle malt. Tastes..tropical fruity, medium bretty funk tartness, late pine slight bitterness and caramel.

The aroma is nicely funky brett with some hoppy pomelo and a touch of burnt rubber or new sneaker smell maybe from a bit of autolysis (yeast cell death). In this case, it doesnt detract much from the aroma as its only noticeable in any quantity as the beer warms and in some ways gives a pleasant complexity to the beer. The beer pours a hazy yellowish with a loose off-white head. Nice lacing on the glass as the beer goes down. Its a fairly light body with a dryish and somewhat bitter aftertaste, but well balanced with the malts and the funk of the brett yeasts. Nice slight alcohol heat as I breathe out through the nostrils. I enjoyed this beer, and I enjoyed it even more as it warmed up a touch. Would drink it again.

Keg at Euston Tap, London. A hazy golden coloured pour with a huge white head on top. Hoppy, fruity, slightly sour aroma. Tastes similar, hoppy, fruity, citrus, tart and slightly sour, slightly bitter. A little unbalanced to me but still quite decent.
Big bright awakening Brett aroma. Cloudy yellow with soft porous white head. Bright flavour. Brett blends in nicely with hops and beer.

Bottle at Pibar, LausanneHazy blond color with generous frothy head. Th aroma is deep and complex, fruity and spicy, oranges, light Brett. Highly carbonated; dry mouthfeel, it has a lot of yeast, Bretts, a lot of bitter oranges, and quite strong bitterness. Expectedly dirty.Powerful and sharp farmhouse ale.

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a good lacing frothy big off-white head. Aroma is peach, barnyard, citrus, flowery and light peppery. Taste is moderate sweet, bitter and mild tart. Body is light, texture is oily, carbonation is lively. Finishes bitter and quite dry. High drinkability.

Bottle.

Head is initially large, frothy, rocky, white, mostly lasting.
Body is hazy medium to dark yellow, unfiltered.

Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), lightly to moderately hoppy (grapefruit, apricot), with notes of rubber/carpet, plastic, pineapple, gum.

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, moderately bitter.

Medium body, watery/velvety texture, lively carbonation, lightly alcoholic.

An unfortunate mix of good and bad...theres some nice tropical fruit character in this but overall the aroma is a just a bit shy and has some poor phenolic character (rubbery). Decent flavor balance, nice yeasty tartness. Id wager this could be near 4.0 quality if brewed somewhere better than Westbrook.

Une bière qui change vraiment, on sent clairement que les petites bêtes qui ont fermentées ce nectar ne sont pas habituelles. Les arômes exotique du houblon sont sublimés par les brett.Cette biere est fraiche, fruitée et gourmande.je rajoute un arôme de mangue et de papaye incroyable.  Elle serait absolument parfaite avec une amertume moins forte.

from Erzbierschof - fully cloudy orange beer with no head retention; fresh fruity hoppiness with notes of apples and grapefruits; hints of candy sugar; quite full-bodied, assertive and light sourish, residual sugars with chewy fruity notes, decently bitter, notes of marzipan and cane sugar - a bit weird but ok

An inviting Brett beer, poured from bottle with whispy golden/coppery colour and short white head that initially pillowed then reduced. Not overbearing but still stands its ground with fruity and malty notes all round, slighty sweet with a complimenting dry, bitter finish. Unique and respectable, Nice job!

Pours a light golden with not much haze but a nice pillow of white head that fades after a minute or two. Nose and taste are missing the brett funk, only slightly showing up in the aftertaste. This beer is a good IPA to be enjoyed immediately.

Bottle, De Bierkoning, Amsterdam. Hazy orange-gold pour with an off white head. Tropical/citrus fruit nose with some sour notes. Flavour had similar qualities with notes of yeast, brett, and hops.Dry bitter finish. Light and easy drinking. Nice one.

Bottle. Hazy medium gold, lively white head. Not mellow by any stretch, but not as boldly characterful as I thought it would be. Pale biscuity malts, a big of green grape sweetness, mild funk, a bit of gooseberry and guava. Very nice.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Mes de noviembre de 2013 botella de 65 cl. Muy buena cerveza muy bien combinado el Amargor Ipa con la acidez de los brett. Cuerpo suave. Hay que tomar de nuevo está cerveza

Pour out of 22 oz bottle, hazy orange pour with white head, lacing well, aroma brought notes of white fruit, funk, slight honey, touch of grass, slight biscuit, cat pee in there. Taste is a mix of biscuit, white fruit, peach, slight cat pee, hints of grass, pine in there, slight earth, finishing bitter, slightly sweet.

Bomber from Barrel and Bottle in North Market, Columbus. Orange-gold pour with medium bright white. Aroma is Belgian yeast and tropical fruit. Tastes are floral bitter, tropical fruit, light tart, hay, earthy. More funky than sour/tart - whatever that means. Nice lively medium palate. I havent been big on the few wild ipas Ive had so far, but this is quite good. I like the mix here - tropical citrus, with funk, with a bitter finish.

Fra fat på Cafe Sara, Oslo nov-13: uklar gylden med filmskum. Syrlig, rustikk friskhet med brett og humle, og med en tørr, litt pepperaktig snert i smaken glir dette foruroligende lett over ganen. India saison gir det beste av to verdener. Godt øl på et hyggelig sted!

Hazy orange colour with an off-white head. Bitter taste of citrus hops, yeast, fruits, brett. Caramel notes too. Nice dry bitter finish.

Excellent beer! Its basically like a hoppy and very funky saison. The aroma is very much of brett; barnyard/ horse blanket aromas. It pours a beautiful golden color with average head. Some citrus hops aromas are also present. The taste is bitter, a little tart and peppery. It is light to medium bodied and has a great dry finish. Overall a must try!

Hazy orange color, good steady white head. Strong Bretta nose: tart and funky with horse saddle and barnyard. Medium-bodied. Not so tart flavor, but evident funky Bretta flavors. It is of course a bit too simple ("all Brett") but not too bad.

Fruity citrus, brett, sweet yeasty and bready malts, some caramel, hoppy bitter finish. Decent drop this.

Love it! Funky aroma with a hoppy note. Taste is sweet, funky, somewhat citrusy, lemon soap, with a hop punch. Finish is dry, aromatic finish... hop burp is awesome. Not as fizzy as other belgium ales, but certainly enough to add to the bitter texture.

Hazy golden with a thin white foamy head. The aroma is wheaty and hoppy and citrusy, a little like a white ipa with grassy leafy hops with a touch of funk. The flavor is Bretty dry with a slightly bactillic woody funk, with a little hoppy orange rind and pollen-like bitterness. Really leafy and dry. Basically a dry hopped sour saison.

Bomber pours a hazy golden/orange with a large off-white head. Aroma of oranges, slight pine and caramel malt, Belgian and Brett yeast. Taste is upfront Belgian yeast and Brett, with dry hop bitterness. Simple balanced and drinkable.

Bottle shared at Beer Study a while back. Pours a hazy orange amber with a well carbonated sudsy white head. Nose is earthy, lightly funky, light tropical fruits, manure, and a light candy like sweetness. Flavor is similardefinitely less bretty, tart, and funky than I expected. Okay beer, but for the price, I was expecting a bit more.
Tap. Hazy yellow, gold with a frothy off white head. Smells or citrus, mango, pine, spice and light funk. Flavor is sweet citrus, pine, spice and some funk as well. Light to medium body. Dry finish.

Lasting frothy white head atop a clouded yellow body. Nose of lemon rind, coriander and Brett. Solid mouthfeel - good hop bitterness, lemon, mango. This stuff is great. Purchased at Metro Liquor at University Heights for $12.
Florecent bright orange yellow. Cloudy. Scents of grapefruit and lemon. Sweet bitter and very hoppy. Delicious
Bottle. Hazy yellow pour, with a white head. Bread, citrus, fruity esters, yeast, brett, and hops. Fairly hoppy brett beer, ok.

650ml bottle from Hippo Beers. Hazy yellow amber, good foamy head. Orange hop aroma. Biscuit & orange flavour. Light well balanced & refreshing citrus aftertaste. Not really sure why this is classed as a Belgian ale. More an American Pale Ale.

Bottled. Pours hazy golden with a large, lacing off-white head. Aroma of brett, caramel, citrus and funk. Sweet flavor that ends up dry, tart and bitter. Medium bodied, watery to oily text. and average carb. Quite nice indeed.

Very clear Brett IPA. Elegant and well balanced herbal spices on top of the pleasant hop head.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This beer is fresh and have a good aftertaste. Good notes of fruits especially citrus
Grassy hops, apparent Brett. Pale light yellow with big white head and laces. Spicy yeast and sweet hops with a good bitter finish. Medium body and lively carb. A good mix of Brett and American hops.
Et spændende miks af en øl, der minder om Orval med et godt skud humle. Brett-gæren giver en særdeles spændende IPA, der smager rigtig godt.
Fine beer! Good bitternes and long aftertaste. Classic pale ale in color and aroma. Just good and tasty

22oz bottle, slight cloudy honey gold hue, with a thick white head, nice pear, mango, peach, tropical fruit, green grapefruit fruity nose from the hops used, with some mild funky wild bretty yeasty, zesty lemon, lime, grapefruit peel accents, with a floral leafy, grassy, piney, minty, tropical fruit hoppy note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a very good flowery citrus, leafy, piney, grassy, tropical fruit hoppy character, with some mild bretty funky yeastiness, zesty lemon, lime peel, faint lemongrass spicy flavours, with a pine bark, lemon pie, mint, faint honeyed pale, toasted malt undertone, leading towards a bretty, funk yeastiness, intense leafy, grassy, piney, tropical fruit, citrus hop bitterness finish.
On tap at Biercab. Hazy yellow-orange colour with white head. Fruity, citric, brett aroma. Fruity, grass, malty taste, also some bretts and bitterness. Medium body.

Smells almost saison fruity like, with some earthy aroma, but not the band aid type. Nice head that lingers. Taste to me is like a saison with a pretty bitter finish and some earthy flavors. Some funk, but no tart. I like the aroma of this one better than the taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at the parentals. Pour is hazy golden orange with a big white head and great lacing. Big bretty, tropically fruity, pineapple, grapefruity, mango, biscuit, grassy, and herbal aroma. Taste is big grassy, fruity hops, grapefruit peel, oranges, biscuit, and mango with a big bitter finish. Medium mouthfeel with high carbonation. Pretty good IPA but I wish the brett would shine through a little more.
Thanks to beechner224. Pours a clear light golden color. Earthy dank hop aroma. Nice hop flavor, citrusy and the brett character comes through. Some slight astringency. Pretty tasty overall.

Bottle share thanks to beechner224. Dough in the nose. Bready. Slightly funky. Tropical fruits. Crackers malt with a touch of barnyard and hay. Overall enjoyable. 

---Rated via intercellular device

Bottle into a nonic pint. Poured with a huge head. Really had to let it settle for awhile. Aroma is faintly citrus and tart Brett character. Not much there though. Taste is the same. A bit thin, light funky citrus and tropical fruits, Brett is surprisingly light, which is a good thing to me. Just overall pretty thin and muddled.

Bottle. Hazy amber with a tall, fluffy white head. Funky yeast, citrus fruit, grassy and floral hops, and pine notes. Taste is piney and floral with grassy notes, funky yeast, toasted malt, soft grains and citrus fruit. Body is medium with a dense, creamy carbonation. Finishes with more strong citrus fruit, pine notes, floral hops, grassy notes, sweet malt, grains, soft bready notes and funky yeast.

Blanding af let Brett og tydelig humle i duft.
Meget skum. Meget.
Lys gul hazy. For lys.
Fin rund, men dog betydelig Brett. Spiller op mod meget humle og bitterhed der efterlader munden tør. Bretten er ikke så meget hestedækken men mere dr. Pepper. Bitterheden er langvarig og overtager, som en god IPA. Ret tør. Ikke så 'fatale' som titlen antyder.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Golden pour with a massive white head. The nose is awesome - bright and flinty with a solid citrus/spice hop nose. Bright and tropical with a long tangerine and some passion fruit. A bit of dry yeasty flintiness but the Brett is pretty restrained. Incredibly aromatic and fruity though. Moderate bitterness and a very lovely fruitiness. Amazingly fragrant and delicious.

22oz bottle from Maltitude in columbus, GA. Pours a golden color with a thick white head. Aroma is citrusy hops. Smells great. Taste is bitter hops up front transitioning into citrusy belgian yeast. Didnt get too much of the bretts in this, but still tastes great. Overall, a great beer.

Bomber and a Teku glass. Hazy yellow with a firm white head. Some dusty farmhouse along with some fruits in the aroma. There is also some hints of bark. Obvious galaxy hops when it hits the tongue. Hints of orange bark, with some hints of lemons and some musk. Bitter dry finish with slight brett. Overall an extremely good beer one from the category I am beginning to simply adore, brett IPA´s.

22 oz bottle. Pours hazy golden orange with a huge rocky white head that retains well and laces the glass.

The aroma is straw malts, Belgian yeast and some tangy tropical fruits and some musty brett.

The flavor is sweet sugary doughy malts with some tangy tropical fruit and light green apple and some earthy Belgian yeast leading to a lightly bitter finish that dries it out some and lingers in the aftertaste. The mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with smooth carbonation.

Overall, a very nice brett beer, but not a lot of hop character other than some bitterness late in the finish.
Bottle @ home. Pours gold with a white head, it almost looks like sparkling wine. Aroma is zesty citrus, funky, grassy. Flavor is citrus, funky, bready, grassy. Nice beer.

Bottle from Save On. Very pale hazy gold with nice lasting head and lace. Mildly tart lemon pastry fresh hoppy aroma. Mild pineapple fruity sweetness with mild funky citrus and mild tart white wine very dry hoppy finish Beautiful soft mouthfeel fine carbo. Not fully funked out yet, but still incredibly delicious and refreshing.
Bottle thanks to adnielsen. Hoppy, sour and funky, hazy grapefruit color. Nice beer, would drink again

Pours a hazy, sort of peach gold with a tall chunky off white head that has great retention and leaves very nice lacing. Aroma of sweet floral notes, tart stone fruit, citrus, tropical fruit, sweet hay, bready malt, fruity, earthy funk, and wet limestone. Flavor is earthy funk and fallen leaves up front, followed by floral, citrus and tropical hoppiness and sweet malt, grassy hay and fruity sweetness, a little resinous and earthy hops and earthy, spicy funk to the finish. Medium body with a sort of slick feel, but a heavy, blanketing and oddly soft carbonation keeps that slick feel from taking over too much. Good stuff, not great.
Tap at Kaisla, Helsinki. Colour is hazy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, Belgian yeast, hops and malts.

Bottle 22oz.
Pours hazy blond with medium white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of citrus, pine, fruits, mango, tropical fruits, bretts. Taste is of pine, citrus, malt, tropical fruits, some bitterness, bretts. Palate: Light body. Overall: Very good. Fruity. Bretty, but not overdone.

Bottle shared with Tom10101, thanks! Pours hazy golden amber with low white head. Overwhelming (and quite pleasant) aroma of tropical fruits (pineapple, manguo), pine, malt and hops. Didnt really catch the brets. Dry. Taste is more malty than exected. Really enjoyable fruity Belgian ale!

Bottle (22 oz). From Sammy, thanks! Hazy yellow/golden with a huge white head, good retention and nice lacing. Aroma of brettanomyces, galaxy hops, light malt and citrus notes. Taste is slightly to moderately sweet with malt, brettanomyces, citrus, light meaty notes and light spiciness. Light to medium body. Moderate carbonation. Slightly dry finish. Good balance. Interesting take on an IPA with brettanomyces. Easily drinkable. I enjoyed it.

(Keg at William K Kurvi, 20130920) The beer poured golden and cloudy. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had fruitiness, pine, sourness and yeast. Palate was medium bodied and too dry with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, pine, sourness, spiciness, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was hoppy, sour and bitter. The yeast had eaten all the sugar resulting in a too dry beer but otherwise the beer worked very well.
Tap at kaisla, helsinki. Hazy golden color, white head. Aroma is hops, citrus, pine, menthol. Citrus hoppy taste, menthol, pine, spices.

Tap (Kaisla, Helsinki)
Hmmm, nice things going up the nose here. Where are the hula skirts? So many tropical fruits. To be honest, Im getting the coconut of sorachi ace too, but not in the usual annoying way. Totally tropical all the way to the finish, but perhaps too much coconut for me to really get into it. Does have nice balance, its a refreshing drinker. A nice sour. Do like it despite the absurd level of fruitiness.

Draught. Pours hazy orange in color with a foamy whitish head. Floral notes, some mild soap and ripe fruity notes in aroma. Some bitter grassy and soapy notes in taste. More bitter grapefruit kind of taste towards the finish. A bit of lemony and peppery spicyness in aftertaste.-- bb/wp
Draught at Rotterdam. Hazy orange color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, earthy notes, floral hops, apricot, resin and grass. Bitter finish with hops and apricot. Excellent IPA.
Aroma av tropisk frukt, med noe syre. Smaken har et klart gårdspreg, med noe syre og tropisk frukt. Et hint av pepper og en tørr avslutning. Meget bra.
Pours golden hue, thick head, aroma of slight hops with sour tones, taste of light hops that is mellow with sour notes fading it out, feels very dry on the palate.

Hazy, straw gold with a thick white head. Aroma is somewhat musty with a touch of hops. Flavor is light citrus hops with a touch of barnyard funk in the finish. Tart finish with a bit of bitterness from the hops.

Wife: 3.7

Aunque debo reconocer que el dia que probé esta cerveza no fue el mejor para tener los sentidos al 100% (digamos que la cata empezó horas antes), es una muy buena cerveza que sorprende por su sabor no-descriptible. Retrogusto intenso, color amarillo pajizo, corona blanca y bien marcada,....,resumiendo: una rica cerveza de fermentacion espontánea, que sorprende!.
Cloudy hay with no head. Peppery with subtle bitterness. Fruity flavors and aromas with slight funk.

650ml bottle. Golden shade with two or three fingers of white head. Leaves some lacing in the glass. Nice tropical hop aroma. Its all mango and papaya at first followed by a rising brett presence. On the tongue sweet, sticky malts arrive first, then an assault of hop bitterness and yeast spiciness floods in. This is really good stuff.

650 mL bottle. Hazy brown-yellow with a medium, sticky, white head. Ames pretty much like an IPA. Im not sure Im getting any Brett in the nose. On my way! Brett in the flavour though, but Otis surrounded by a pretty solid IPA. Pineapple and citrus. Medium-high carbonation.
Hazy light gold with thock white head. Aroma is light sweet. Taste is light citrus and peach. Descent but not great.

Keg at CBC Clerkenwell 2nd BDay Extravaganza. It pours bright yellow with a medium white fizzy head. The nose is robust, bright citrus and some herb but with a barn yard piss undertone. The taste is a mellow orange citrus with a musty blanket funk. Not a lot of depth, most of the flavor is up front, then just a lingering citrus bitter sweet with a bit of funk. I liked it.

Bottle shared at Olympen Friluft, july 2nd 2013. Hazy golden body, foamy white head. Aroma is light funky with citrus, peach, orange. Dry nice bretty body, refreshing hoppy taste with brett, sour hints but not overdone. Clean bitterness, and a fruity and yeasty finish. A dash more hops wouldnt hurt, but the beer is quite nice as it is.

Absolutely delicious. The beer pours hazy and yellow gold. The color is quite pale for an IPA. The head is foamy and white. The aroma is pretty wonderful. Loads of bright citric hops and a good deal of funky yeast character. Its all tangerine rinds and farmhouse. Some honeysuckle in there, as well. Taste starts sweet with more bright, fresh citrus but quickly dries out and gives a little bitter bite. If the beer were sweeter, Im not sure that there would be enough bitterness for me, but as is, its just incredibly refreshing. Sort of a funky twang in the finish. Feel is light and airy with some hop oiliness. This is very much a brett IPA. Its big on fresh, bright citrus, brett funk and dry very light malt. Great for a hot day. Its just wonderfully put together and makes me want to buy more of those pricey Evil Twin bottles.

Pours hazy yellow / orange with a white head. The aroma has piny and grapefruit hops, light from, some pithiness, mild malt and a mere hint of brett - very clean and hoppy. It has a medium body, lightly rough and has a grainy feel along with having semi-sharp carbonation. The flavor starts with earthy/piny/grapefruit hops with a bit of lightly toasted malt and some mild fruit. The finish is pretty harsh with the hops and shows hints of the brett bugginess, but its pretty mild. There is a pleasing lingering resin going on. Pretty solid.

Pours dark gold, white head. Nose is mainly citrus - lots of tangerine - and funk in the background. Flavour is same, tartness is pretty subdued. Mixed with a bit of earth on the finish. Lots of aspects battling it out here.

Bottle. Pours hazy gold with medium sized fluffy white head. Aromas of pineapples, mangos, papayas and other ripe, sweet fruit, Brett, grass and citrus. Quite aromatic. Taste is lemony grassy hops, fermented fruit, yeast, and a good amount of Brett funkiness. Hop bitterness and funkiness/fermented fruit dominate. Finish is a little muddled and as not well balanced as it could be.

22 oz bottle. Pours a cloudy gold with light head. Aromas of grapefruit and ripe peaches. Flavors of pink grapefruit, orange juice and malts. Nice tangy edge. The brett really adds to and brings out the snappiness of the Pacific Northwest hops. Very nice.

On tap at the ratebeer gallery event. It pours a yellow color with a white head. The aroma has a complex bouquet of hops floral, pineapple, grapefruit and spice with background funkiness. The flavor is the same with the funk coming out stronger near the finish. Nice.

Excelente ipa! O brett deixa o seu aroma irresistível e da uma leve acidez ao sabor. É uma cerveja para os amantes do lúpulo, visto que ela é bem carregada no amargor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap - Ratebeer event. Pours hazy yellow amber. Aroma is citrusy, grapefruit, Brett, funk. Flavor is the same, fruity, lightly sweet and lightly bitter. Pretty nice beer.

On tap at the RateBeer Gallery event in SF. Pours orange-gold with a big fluffy white head. Big tropical and citrus fruity character, with orange, lemon, pineapple. A little soapy at times, slight pale malt notes, dry astringent finish with bretty phenols creeping in.

The Femme fatal 
Sounds cool to try
Smells like Perfume
Taste sucks...dont buy

Poured into an ISO Tasting glass from a bottle.

Smell: Slight citrus/pine, hop aroma is underwhelming. Barnyard and cheesy umami smells from the brett are overwhelming. Slightly musty. Has "complexity" but is overall strange and underwhelming.

Appearance: Super opaque and hazy, 4ish SRM, white head has a moderate retention. Pretty poor lacing.

Taste: Black pepper spice, the brett barnyard/umami funk from the nose is highly present. Hop presence is pretty underwhelming and leaves me to say this doesnt belong in the IPA category. Aftertaste reminds me of eating a sharp, old, funky hard cheese.

Mouthfeel: Medium-light body, medium-low carbonation. Astringent and cheesy lingering mouthfeel.

Overall: Entirely disappointed by this beer. Came highly recommended but lacks any idea of subtlety or complexity. 100% brett can probably be done well, but this is not that beer. Comes across as eating a strong sharp cheddar, which seems cool and novel at first, but becomes cloying before finishing your first glass.
@Magic City Brewfest. Hazy golden with aroma citrus hops. Some hop bitterness with some Brett tartness.

Cheers to Ben at Sams Quik Shop for the birthday beer. Pours a bright golden, slightly hazy with a thin white head. Nose is citrusy but backed up by some lovely brett, farmhouse, hay, funk and acetic notes. Easy drinking and refreshing as hell.

Tap at Stagshead sour night and this was best of bunch fo sho.  pours light orange with foamy head and nice bretty nose.  tastes of lemony citrus, hay, other barnyard, yellow apples, coriander, banana, vanilla, and plenty of brett.  very refreshing and lively on palate

Botttle. Poured a yellow color with huge (well pours all head) head. Not a gusher, but some spray when opened. Again, pours all head and takes a while to settle into something I can drink Aromas of spices, some fruitiness, and brett. Tastes of citrus, fruits, the same spiciness, and some funkiness. Flat body.

On tap at Smoke and Barrel DC.  The keg kicked and the bartender gave me maybe 3oz of the last pour.  Great guys there.  Pours a cloudy, bright gold with some wispy white head.  Surprised with a big, floral, hop aroma, citrus peel, pine, some soap, a little grape, some malt too, tropical fruit, a little musty.  Flavor is very similar, sweet, but mostly zippy hops, lemon, orange, scallion, chive, perhaps the brett is manifested in some grassiness.  Slightly bitter, crisp, dry finish.  Really nice.  Very drinkable.
Bottle into glass..  hazy cloudy orange pour .. white head... taste is grapefruit ..joy  awesome well balanced goodness

Bottle. Hazy yellow with a medium sized good lacing white head. Smells pretty crisp and hoppy. Juicy yellow apples, leathery brett, barnyard, and citrus in the aroma. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium body, oily texture, soft/medium carbonation. Light dry and bitter finish. High drinkability.
Pours a cloudy golden with a huge and lacing white head leaving quite some lacework. Bretty, farty nose. Thin body, very dry fruit, yeast and Brett. Rather dry and bitter finish.
On tap at Torst.  This has an unusual mix of elements. Excellent meadow-like aroma.  It tastes like an APA with a little brett sourness, pink grapefruit, and a dash of brine. Good.

loved the Noir so somewhat intrigued to try this .. . gold .. great foam, lacing also .. . decent brett feel, but a bit airy .. . spritz level is off too .. . has the character but no substance at all .. . . don t you hate it when you hit your laptop so hard it turns off and mutters go fuck yourself...

Draft at Local Option, served in a stemmed glass that reminded me of the Goose Island Matilda glass in shape. Pours a hazy pale orange color with a fizzy white head that fizzles out quickly. Surprisingly huge hops on the aroma for a beer with Brett in the name. In fact, Brett takes a backseat to the citrusy, fresh, fruity hops throughout. Funky and bitter, with crisp carbonation. Dry finish. Drinks like a Bretted Belgian IPA. Refreshing.
Pours cloudy amber with a white head. Aroma is caramel, grapefruit and citrus. Flavour is malt, grapefruit, brett and light citrus. Very dry.

Bottle 650ml, a slightly cloudy yellow beer with huge head. Nose is on lichee and apricot. Aroma is on bitter grapefruit with light brett background, over-riped fruit, mandarine, quite unusual but easily drinkable. Brett are more present at the very end finish with lemony touch. Fine and refreshing, a bit too much grapefruit for me.

It poured a hazy yellow color with a foamy white head. The aroma was of caramel, citrus, brett and a somewhat tart finish. The taste was of brett, citrus, tropical and herbal hops with a medium body. Good stuff.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2015 Hazy dark golden color with a medium sized, white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of vanilla, brett, grass, funk, citrus, and tropical fruits. Taste of toasted malts, brett, citrus, tropical fruits, funk, and a bretty finish.

Wonderful aroma, full of citrus and hop goodness. Pours light golden with a nice finger of head. Very smooth, very well balanced, crisp, not too bitter, and not dry at all on the finish. A well rounded brew.

Hazy yellow color, medium sized white head. Smell is pretty fruity, hops, slightly a sweet hint. Taste lightly malty, fruitpeel, slight bitterness, only the slightest hint of brett. Nicely balanced. Quite like it

Sampled on 11/3/2012. This Belgian style IPA pours a medium orange gold color from a 22oz bottle. Small to medium sized white foamy head. The aroma is fruity and sweet, citrusy, grapefruity and bretty. A medium bodied sour/wild IPA. The malts are fruity and sweet, orange and citrus. The hops are grapefruity. Mild carbonation. Nice balance between the hops, malt, tart and funk. Nothing over powers anything else. Not really sure just what style of beer this is. Is there a bretty/funky IPA category? Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is bone dry and crisp. Aftertaste is slightly tart and funky.\

Hazy gold body with a small fluffy white crown on the first pour. Wow what is this beer I was not expecting a hoppy beer. Peachy yeast, hints of funk, vanilla, mild spice. I can smell both an IPA and a Belgian............. I normally never like this mix of styles but this is something special. Taste is epic. This perfectly the beer I was in the mode for. Peach, banana, yeast, apricot, so yummy. Heavily carbonated, it stings the throat. So very hoppy, so very yeasty, only mildly funky. I could drink this constantly. The faint malts are toasty, overall its sweet, medium bitter. This beer is MIND = BLOWN!!!

Love the golden orangey body with a puffy dense white head and tons of tiny spritzy bubbles in the body. The nose is bretty with mild funk and barnyard notes, a noted resinous and grapefruit hops with a hint of honey sweetness. Sweet toasty malts, light caramel and a moderately bitter complex medley of fruits and citrus resiny notes hit with mild bretty flavours. SUper silky and smooth flavour overall. Just fantastic!

Bottle, RB Århus tasting @ Christers. Pours hazy yellow with a white head, some floaties. Aroma of malt, brett, cheese, flowers, citrusly hops. Flavor is malt, brett, sweet fruity, peach, melon, cheese, citrus. Medium body, soft carbonation, dry light bitter finish. Wonderfull balance and very easy drinking. 030413
Four finger head, white, creamy, golden orange color, funky aroma, tart with a bitter finish, I like this beer.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are citrus, flowers, brett, pine and malt. Easy drinkable. Nice and light. Wonderfully balanced.

Bottle. Slightly hazy yellow with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, peach and citrus. Flavour is malt, hops, citrus, peach, brett, medium bitter, little sweet, little dry, little floral and tropical fruits.

Bottle @ Aarhus-Randers tasting. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, light bretty and moderate hoppy - fruity and citrus. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 0403013
Bottle. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Moderate bitter flavor.  Average moderate bitter finish. Creamy palate. Wonderfull beer.

Cloudy pale golden body with a white head. Nice yeasty flavour with lemon, orange, pineapple, peach and other fruits. Medium, thinly carbonated body. Great, slightly bitter and yeasty flavour with orange, wheat, lemon, with a dusty citrus finish. Very nice.
On tap at Pizzeria Paradiso.  Nose has mild funk along with heavy tropical fruit notes and faint citrus rind. Moderately bitter on a fairly light body. Heavy fruit. Dry.
Draft at Eulogy. Cloudy pale orange with a lasting white foam. Very dry floral. Lots of citrus pith. Orange seeds. Green pepper. Lemon zest. Medium body.

650ml bomber bottle pours a hazy golden orange color with a finger and a half of white head that leaves some nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma is light fruits with hints of yeast.  Taste is a tart fruitiness with some sweet malts and a yeasty dry finish.  Medium bodied with loads of carbonation leaving a pleasant tingle on the palate.  An interesting and tasty brew that I recommend others to sample.
Bottle from Premiere recent trip.  Lots of brett balanced with the hoppy IPA.  Very good drinkability.  Above average smooth mouthfeel.  Light yellow with a beige tinge.  Mild hop aroma.
tap at torst.   big pear, dry melon, pineapple.    some sweaty brett.   bubblegum.   good not great.

Draft. Hazy gold pour, white head, good lace. Aroma is fruity, tropical hops/brett, citrus, light dust. Taste is lightly bitter, citrus, topical, dusty. Palate is soft, quenching, lightly bitter finish. Very good.
Just had this at Torst and it blew me away. The Brett is outstanding with the hops, just a real treat of a beer!
Hazy yellow pour with a fluffy white head.  Loads of brett hit up front then you get the dank and citrus hops followed by some malt.  Finishes funky, leathery, earthy.  Cool stuff!

Pours a hazy blond with a thick white head.  Aroma is bretty and grapefruity/rindy.  Flavor follows suit...very nice grapefruit and citrus rind with a touch of bretty funk.  Mouthfeel is medium...a bit chewy really...and the finish is dry and citrus rindy/funky.

Bottled. Clear golden color, short frothy head. Aroma has some barnyard, floral and grassy hop, some tropical fruits, hint of garlic and onion even. Quite dry taste, firm bitterness because of the dryness. Citric, slight astringent. There is some slight brett in the flavor, but it probably needs some more time to develop properly. For now, its ok, but no more than that.
On draft at blue monk, really hazy orange yellow pour. Smells floral,  citrus sweet. Tastes very delicate, orange sweetness, a bit of sour from the brett, and a little hop bitterness. Very nice.

On tap at the Bulldog in Baton Rouge. Pours a hazy gold color with a white head. I get a bit of biscuit malt and citrus in the aroma and flavor, but there is also a good deal of brett. The hops are fairly subdued, but the brett keeps the beer from being too sweet or malty. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Nice.

Pale, hazy, straw colored pour with a white head. Some peppery spiciness, lemon zest, cracker malt, and nice tropical fruit notes. Citrus peel, light pine, and a nice yeast note. The flavor is certainly dry. Cracker malt notes, nice lemon notes, tropical fruit, orange peel, and mild pine. A light bitterness with some good pepper spiciness.

65cl, new exclusive Danish brew Anno 2012, with Brettanomyces, from De Molen Beershop Bodegraven, complex brew, fruity/bitter and slightly malty/woody, easy to drink, very balanced, cloudy, rocky head, good brew, yet expensive!
Sampled on tap at The Bridge on 01/12. Pours a golden color with white head.  Funk, malt, honey, brett flavors.  Cool brett beer, fun to try.

Hazy pale gold color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of yeast, rich floral, apricot/mango, & spice; Flavor sweet malt, yeast, hops, fruit, citrus, and some pepper; Finish is dry & fairly bitter; Nicely balanced; Interesting and funky - good overall.
Pours clear straw with a white lacey head. Aroma brings sweet candy of the Brett so nice in the nose. Flavor of spicy and aged sweet Brett yeast on a clean body.

Bottle.  Hazy deep golden/amber pour with thin white head.  Nose of dried citrus, mango, lemon, faint banana, yeast, mild spice, coriander, light leather, plastic, and a whiff of floral hops.  Flavor is a light fruity malt with mild brett leather, light plastic/vinyl, and a moderate bitter hop finish.  While the nose was intriguing, the taste fell a little flat.  A higher carb level probably would have elevated this one a bit.
Dampolla. De color groc i escuma blanca. Aroma bastant afruitat, llúpol, una mica un toc dolç. Sabor lleuger de malt, amargor lleu, només el més mínim indici del Brett. Molt ben equilibrat.

Bottle. Pours mostly clear golden with a medium white head. The aroma is Brett, citrus and fruity hops. The flavour is dry and bretty with sweet fruity hops. Bitter grapefruit finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle pours a thick murky peach with a thin white head that dissapated quickly and excellent lacing. Aroma is an awesome, enormous blend of tropical fruit, passion fruit, and Brett. Taste begins with big citrus followed by enjoyable tart flavor, subtle peach and mango, before a Brett finish.  Tropical and funk flavors linger.

Tap.  Half-finger of pure white head, on a slightly hazy yellow orange body. Peach, mango, some hay and candy in the aroma.  No very bretty in the flavor either, with sweet peach meat, mango, slight grassiness and earth. Lighter to medium body thats soft overall.  Decent

On tap at The Bridge Tap House, 12 oz snifter... 

Appearance; a glorious golden color, nearly no head and absolutely zero lacing... I think that is pour related however...

Aroma; holy succulent tropical vacation... Lush peach, apricot, citrus rinds, pineapple and gentle hints of resin...

Taste; this brew is incredibly complex, peach and apricot jump right out at me, tons of citrus, notes of pineapple and a hint of resinous bite on the finish.

Palate; this brew is light-medium bodied but could do with a touch more carbonation... Other than that, utterly fantastic.

Overall; I passed on this in a bottle but was convinced to try it on tap... I will be going back for bottles, this beer is outstanding, not overly sour or bitter, not too much IPA or Brett, this is an extraordinarily well rounded and unique beer that you need to try.

Draught at Breukelen Bier Merchants.  Clear gold not much head. Aroma unjustly big American west coast hops....sweet ripe tropical fruit and a little dank funk.  The flavor is the same with a bit more citrus, grapefruit, and a clean bitterness.  The Brett is overwhelmed.  Slick mouthfeel with moderate pickle.  Decent beer though misleading.

Cloudy yellow color with one finger of white head. Really floral and fruity in nose.
Medium body and average carbonation.  In mouth is like a good brett have to be. Floral and pine hops, citric, orange and medium bitternes in the end.

Pours light yellow nearly clear with a big white head.  Pretty hoppy but finishes with a nice tart taste.  A nice funky beer.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A - Hazy golden-yellow with a big finger of frothy white head. The head fades down at a very slow pace.

S - Funky and lightly tart Brett, grapefruit, citrus, and light pine hops, some sweet caramel and lightly grainy malts, lemon zest.

T - Funky and tart brett, tart green fruits, lemon peel, grapefruit, orange, citrus, and light pine hops, some bitterness, sweet caramel and lightly grainy malts, some farmhouse flavors.

M - Medium bodied with full carbonation. Smooth with a tart, dry, and funky finish.

D - Nice Brett beer. The hops make for a good balance with the Brett character.

Shared a bottle with greenclansman. Pours a golden yellow. Initial over carbonation, caused a huge foamy head. Aroma is super amazing. Brett all the way. Lots of sourness on the nose. Nice beer but think this specific bottle was overcarbonated. Other wise a very nice beer.

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2016 Me enamoré!!Justo recién salida de trabajar...fue tenerla en el vaso..olerla y decir "oh sí!!el mejor momento del día!!"Es fresca, floral, imaginativa, alegre... Una gran cerveza sí señor.
