Plenty of carbonation. Potent floral, exotic fruits dominated by peach/mango but also citrus. Very dry no tartness. A little sweetness in the end. A very supricing Brett.

22 oz. bottle, pours a clear golden with a small white head. Nose blends characteristics of both an IPA and a brett bomb, with the brettanomyces immediately apparent, along with some piney hops, biscuity malts and some slight tangy funk from the brett. Flavour is similar, with the light-to-moderately funky brett upfront, burying the hops a bit though there is feint reminiscent of piney hops and biscuity malt underneath. The more I drink, the more I get prominent cat pee qualities as well, probably from the citra. Light-bodied and very drinkable. Decent stuff.

Bomber from Sams, Durham. Nice looking beer, a boisterous pale gold pour with a roiling head. Nice tart fruit and brett in the nose, along with massive dry hops. Lively mouthfeel, prickly and some spice on the finish. But the taste was a little overwhelming, with the citrus rind and bitter hops framing things but an almost disconcerting amount of brett and some sweetness to clash just a bit. Solid enough but was hoping for more.

22 ounce bottle, my bottle says it was brewed at Westbrook Brewing, SC (USA).  The beer pours a bright gold color with about an inch white head.  Head retention and lacing are both good.  Aroma is nice, the brew smells mostly like citrusy hops (grapefruit, pineapple), along with some brett, floral hops and bready malt.  Taste is mostly like the aroma, but I think the brett comes out stronger in the taste.  Theres some citrusy and floral hop flavors noticeable, and bready malt is in there too.  Mouthfeel/body is medium, its slick with moderate carbonation.  I liked this brew, I might have to pick up another bottle in the future.  $8.99 a bottle.

Very easy to drink with the lighter body and lower ABV - drinks like it is sessionable but just a touch too strong to really be a session beer. Very enjoyable with wonderful tropical hop flavors and aromas and just enough brett. Definitely one I would recommend and have again

Hazy golden colour, white head. Aroma of hops, brett, citrus, light funk. Bitter hoppy, fruity flavour. Quite light body, light bitter lemon peel, medium to long finish.
(From 66cL bottle @ Colins 2nd Tuesday Tasting @ De Molen)
Hazy orange with soapy white head. Fresh hops, brett quite some, nice bitterness. Well drinkable body. Light funk in the end. Bit thin. Nice. (At Colins De Molen tasting)

Bottle at the De Molen second Tuesday tasting. Poured a clear light yellow with a very thin white head. The aroma is very fruity with peachy notes. The flavour is bitter fruity and with a nice bitter lingering aftertaste. A very drinkable beer despite the similarity to a number of other beers Ive tasted.
Bottle. Hazy golden pour, white head. Aroma is hoppy with touches of honey. Bitter flavor, little brett touches. Did expect more of the Brett influences, but still a very nice beer.

At De Molen tasting. Hazy yellow color, medium sized white head. Smell is pretty fruity, hops, slightly a sweet hint. Taste lightly malty, fruitpeel, slight bitterness, only the slightest hint of brett. Nicely balanced. Quite like it.

Bottle @ 2nd tuesday tasting at De Molen, hosted by dEnk. Hazy golden pour, foamy white head. Aroma is spicy, slightly funky, sweetish and fruity. Flavor is slightly fruiity, spicy and somewhat funky. Subtle yet well balanced.

Sample at the monthly molen Tuesday tasting.
Thin white head.  Hazy blond pour.  Very good for a Brent beer. Peach in the aftertaste
Cloudy blond, huge white head. Funky sweet candy aroma, some hops. Taste is zuurtjes, Brett, yeast, some cooky dough and hoppy fruitiness.
Bottle @ 2nd tuesday tasting. Aroma is hoppy, some fruity notes, some spices, not a whole lot of brett. Flavour is dry sourish bretty fruity notes, some malty notes. Very nice.

Comprada en Cervezorama. Tenía muchas expectativas con esta cerveza pero se han defraudado un poco. Como IPA es sensacional, el Brett casi no se nota y la cantidad de gas ingente que tiene hizo que apenas pudiera saborearla.
Color dorado, espuma muy blanca, abundante y consistente. Gas por un tubo, aroma cítrico y resinoso, postgusto corto con un ligero toque ácido. No al nivel de lo esperado.

Shared bottle @Papsoes.  Blond lacing top. Body is cloudy orangey golden. Fruity hops hit the nose at first, offset by some funky brett tones. Taste is quite bitter. Fruity bitter with notes of orange marmelade. Mild sourness, hint of horse stable and wood. Bone dry, nice fruity bitter finish. Drinks very good.  Yum! [14.07.12]
Bottle. Pours gold with a white head. Fruity and piney hops, bretty yeast, flowery and grainy notes, and a medium bitter finish. Spritzy and refreshing.
Hazy golden colour. Hoppy pine citrus aroma. Taste is sweet, floral with some brett character

Bottle... Cloudy golden ale with a small, creamy, white head. The bouquet is of spicy clove and gentle acidity. Medium to full-bodied with laid-back carbonation. The flavor leans heavily toward the bitter side of balance, but is also a bit tangy with a spicy pinch of clove. Finishes tangy with lingering bitterness. Bottle courtesy of growler!

(50cl bottle, BB 2013)  Pours a hazy golden body with a foamy white head.  Aroma of potpourri, florals, horse blanket, pear, leather, barnyard, caramel, and apricot.  Flavor of brett, herbs, grass, florals, and citrus with a dry, bitter finish.

amazing aroma...golden color
sweet taste. mango...with a great aftertaste. very nice beer

One of the few IPAs that we had in our epic tasting last night. I really liked this. Very sticky with pungent hops. Floral and tangy. The Brett is done in a way that doesnt degrade the rest of the beer. It was funky but still easy to drink. Still an IPA through and through but with a simple something extra. Great experience.
50 cl bottle @ home. Pours cloudy orange with a white head that leaves a lot of lacing. Aroma is leather, funk, yeast, and exotic fruit. Flavour is exotic fruit, citrus, and brett.

Bottle shared at the Richmond Industry Gathering. Pours a hazy yellow color with a thin head. Fair head retention. Aroma of caramel, citrus, brett and a tart finish. The taste is brett, citrus, tropical, herbal hops. Medium bodied. Nice beer.

Cloudy orange, loose white head. Huge grapefruit aroma - not what I was expecting, but Im good with it. Not a whole lot brett character in this - seems like a nice citrusy IPA more than anything. Tasty, though.

500 ml bottle poured a cloudy gold with a lasting off white head. Aromas of horseblanket, barnyard, straw, lemon zest, floral notes and light spice. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a smooth dry finish. Flavors of straw, lemon zest, barntard and earthiness with a smooth dry tart lingering funky bitter finish.

Draft at railroad.  Pours clear yellow with no head.  Decent carbonation.  The aroma has a funky lemon and Belgian yeast.  Its almost a Brett Saison aroma.  The taste is dry and Saison-like with an interesting funky finish.

Bottle. Pours opaque orange with big fizzy white head. Aroma is straight Brett with some citrus and fruity hop notes. Flavor is citrus and tropical fruit. Light bodied, especially for an IPA, with ample carbonation. Super sour Brett combined with the bitterness of the IPA make for a loooooong, complex finish.

11/1/12. 22oz(ish) bottle thanks to nulledge! Hazy orange pour with a small khaki head. Lightly fruity, funky aroma with a hint of alcohol. Really fruity hop flavor with a bitter kick, some funk, and a nice lingering dryness. Tasty!

Draft.  Small off-white head, cloudy straw body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, straw, spicy/white pepper, some funk, orange, light coriander.  Taste is medium sweet, grass/straw, cardamom, some white pepper, funk, light orange.  Light-medium body, light effervescence, fairly drinkable.
From a bottle at an evil twin food pairing at ChurchKey in DC. Pours a  dark yellow with an off white head.  Sour lemon nose.  Salty hop notes.  Bitter finish.
bottled, thanks to bu11zeye, orange yellow pour, sour medicinal aroma, flavor is bretty sour earthy with medicinal notes, herb

Draft at Churchkey. Very cloudy apricot pour with small white head. Nose and flavor marked with peach, dry unripe stone fruit, grape must, nice yeasty funk. Drinkable and nicely attenuated. Quite solid.

Aroma of sour grapefruit, citrus and slight bleach.  Pours hazy and blode.   Taste is typical IPA grass and citrus with a hint of funktly yeast.  The brett doesnt shine like Id hoped.  But nice beer nonetheless.
Awesome beer here.  Tons of brett character that produce a real musty farmhouse element with a little tartness.  The hops are hugely present as well with great tropical flavors.

Bomber from Frank Smiths.  Pours clear canary with big fluffy white head and lively carbonation.  Nose is big mangoey hopcitrus, yeasty funky malt, and peppery notes.  Tastes funky and yeasty, with mangoey tropical citrus, floral hops, peppery spice, and an overall complex finish.  Not super yeasty, but Im sure this would age well, as there is a good half inch of yeast on the bottom.

Cloudy yellow golden pour, light orange tint and a ring of white head ... aroma of piney and lemony hops with light brett and some citrusy rinds .... taste is rindy and citrusy with orange and lemony hops ... little piney with a light sour and tart brett, nice bitter dry hoppy bite .... finishes dry and bitter with a lingering citrusy bitter bite .... galaxy hops are very present in this one ... sessionable and tasty

Pours deep hazy gold into a snifter. Off-white head with excellent retention pancakes leaving spider lacing. Sweet tropical fruit, resin and brett aromas. Medium bodied with caramel upfront turning to aspirin and marshmallow before the dry, lasting tart grapefruit finish.
this kinda rocked, very bretty nice ipa. light body, very clean and bright brett flavors, evil twin does it again
Aroma is a mix of piney hops, Belgian yeast and mild mustiness.  The flavor is grapefruit, tropical fruit, mild sweetness, hop resin and a long and tangy finish.

Clear golden w big white head lacing for days retentive... Light grassy aroma, light Brett, some mild grapefruit and stone fruit notes... Medium body, refreshing, easy drinking... Light Brett grapefruit flavor some light light bitterness... Great flavor, excellent pale ale...

Bottle sample at the Evil Twin tasting at Blacklick Wine & Spirits on 10/4/12. Clear yellowish orange color with a thin white head. Aroma of peach, grapefruit, funky brett and grassy hops. Peach and grassy hop flavor with citrus character before a pepper and spicy yeast finish.

On tap in a tulip.  Pours cloudy orange/golden with a lacy, off-white head.  Aroma of spicy yeast, some caramel malts, and a lot of floral almost citrusy hops.  Flavor the same.  Average texture.  A pretty good beer.

Draft at sb. Pours a hazy medium gold with a loose creamy white head. Big fresh lemony nose with spicy undertones. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Beautiful lemon and other fruity overtones, mild spice behind. Delicious.
bomber shared by jsprime. hazy golden, lasting white head. hoppy nose and flavour. brett adds some dirtiness. decently drinkable but dosnt feel complete.

Bottle at Stockholm Beer and Whiskey Festival 2012. Hazy yellow liquid with small white head. Aroma of sweet red berries/blackberries, tropical fruit funk, sweat, wheat and grain. Taste is dry and light bitter with notes of tropical fruit funk, sweat and bubble gum. Light to medium bodied with high carbonation. Just OK.

Draft. Poured hazy golden color with a large frothy off-white head that was lasting with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy fruit sweet , bubblegum yeast, earthy funk aroma. Medium to full body with a slick dry texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy sweet flavor with a medium to heavy funk sweet finish of moderate to long duration. My expectations where exceeded.

Bomber.  Pours a slightly cloudy pale gold with a medium-sized white head that leaves a lot of lacing.  Aroma and flavor is citrus, tropical fruit, some funk, bitter, a bit of bubblegum.  Somewhat thin mouthfeel.  Good bretty beer, but not the best Ive had.
Sampled at an esbls tasting.  Brett is prominent in the flavor.  Softer fruit and some mild bitterness.  Earthiness.  Not bad.

Pours a slightly hazy orange yellow with a fizzy three finger head that settles and laces fairly quickly.... on the nose its funky but subtle... barnyard earthy spice and hay, bubblegum, cinnamon, citrus. Good carbonation with a medium to full mouthfeel fading into a slightly watery but bitterfunk finish. The palate is well balanced with a complex array of grassy citrus hops played well off funky yeast.  Tasty.

Bottle...  Poured orange with a white head.  This beer really under-impressed me.  Lots of hop tones, cascade and citra came through especially for me.  Citrus and piney.  The mouthfeel felt dry and over attenuated.  Some light fruits and yeast spice.  Sort of meh.
Bottle @ Odense Tasting, Oktober 2012. Pours cloudy dark orange with a small white head and lacings. Brett, funk, yeast and some fruity hops. Smooth and dry. Funky.

FC Nordsjælland vs. Chelsea FC Champions League football night tasting in Odense, October 2012. Hazy golden with a lasting white head. Funky aroma with grapefruit and tangerine peel, some leather and barnyard, a hint of pineapple, and undeniably a touch of urinals... Dry and bitter with some green leaves flavour, pineapple, grapefruit and pine. Not entirely in harmony

Bomber from Monument in Concord, CA. Pours dishwater gold with a slight off-wite head. Aroma of fruit and citrus with a fair dose of sour. Med minus body. Flavor is citrus, earthy, sour over light caramel, with a rebound to something like a citrusy IPA. Finishes with light sour all over. Very light.

Bottle shared by bhensonb. Pours dirty golden with a modest off-white head and a fruity aroma. There is a  very fruity flavor over a thin slightly sour pale malt base. Not much carbonation. Refreshing but not particularly interesting.

Tap at OL&R. Hazy gold, wispy white head with floating thin ring. Nose is light toast with heavy candied orange, bubble gum sweetness but held in check to add pleasant balance. Heavy toast and iron  front and mid suppress experience, light orange and oil bitterness through the slippery finish, soft body allows for strong elements to dominate, but enough present to create an experience.
Stockholm Beer 2012: En ganska torr och trevlig doft med tydlig humle. Smaken är lite mer tillbakelutad men det är en frisk och trevlig öl.

Sample at SBWF 2012.

Hazy orange with a small white head. This was a special one. Brett and citrus both in the aroma and taste. Also yeast, fruit, some spices and cellar. Quite refreshing in a strange way. I was not totally convicted but it certainly had some charm.

Bottle 500ml @ ClubGonzo
Pours cloudy golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, brett, fruity, citrus, herbs and cat piss. Taste is light to medium sweet, medium to heavy bitter and light sour with a long fruity, brett and dry finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

(500ml bottle thanks to bu11zeye best by 2013) Clear gold, very lasting white fine head. Nose of heavy Brett, floral, earth, juicy fruit, cilantro, very herbal. Taste of earth, juicy fruit, floral, dirt, unique but odd.

Bottled. Light amber coloured. Unclear. Dense beige head. Aroma: Grape, Brett, sourness, flowers. Flavour: Loads of grapy and sour notes. Some fruits, some flowers, some Spice. Medium to full bodied. Ends grapy and bretty bitter. Is a bit orvally, and that aa compliment in my book.

Tap at Of Love & Regret. Pours low haze golden with small white foam. Sharp hoppy nose with tropical fruits. Mango and pineapple. Taste is thicker mango pulp with pineapple juice. Dry, mildly bitter, quenching. Very good. Webby lacing. Prickly carbonation. Nose brings out very earthy mango and jackfruit. Interesting NZ hops perhaps. Perhaps a bit too much canned pear and canned peach character. Dry and bitter palate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours cloudy yellow gold, thin white head. Aroma is funky horse blanket and cat piss, fruity tangerine notes. Taste is sweeter than expected, very fruity with faint caramel behind it, didnt get the funk I wanted from the brett in the flavor, so I think ill get another and put some time on it, smooth finish, hardly bitter, mouthfeel is smooth as well expected more carbonation. Pretty good, just wanted more funk.

Bottle. Pours light orange, hazy with frothy (whipped egg-white like) head. Nose is a combination of very fruity tones - peaches, oranges - with a good stables/horse/funk aroma. Very interesting, and quite alluring, not as sour-funky as a lambic or similar. Body is fullish, some sourness, but only slightly in a woody-like manner. Bitter, dry, palate-cleansing. This is really interesting stuff.

Tap at Blind Tiger during Farewell to Legs: Hazy golden pour, nose is light funk, brett and horseblanket. Lemony hops and wheat grains.Hay and caramel in the aftertaste. Hoppy, dry finish with astringency and brett.
Bottle. Pours orange with white head. Nose/taste of citrus, wild yeast, herbs and spices and light dry breads. Lighter bodied.

Bottle, shared with BBGTC. Hazy deep orange body, large off-white creamy head. Nose gives the impression of fresh bushes or leaves, citrus, hints of parsley and apricot. Subtle but nice. Taste is apricot, cat pee-ish herbal notes, sour grassy hops and a dry, medicinal bitterness not quite to my liking. Full body, medium carbonation. Weird, and not too convincing, but at least original.

Shared bomber to snifter. Looks good; a hazy orange with white lacing. Smells solid; citrus hops and funky yeast. Tastes like it smells with an average mouthfeel. Good, not great; not worth the price tag.

Tap pours radiant yellow with white fizz. The nose is robust, bright citrus and some herb but with a barn yard piss undertone.  The taste is a mellow orange citrus with a musty blanket funk. Not a lot of depth, most of the flavor is up front, then just a lingering citrus bitter sweet with a bit of funk. Not bad tho, a good change if pace from a bunch of other sour beers.

On tap. Totally hazy pale orange color. Very thin web of head on the surface, leaves good lace. The brett IPA is a very exciting new sub-category of IPA, and this is one excellent example. Excellent light, crisp carbonation, clean finish - refreshing, yet delicious full flavor. Delicious belgian yeast, citrus hops, nice funk. Light peppery aftertaste. Great lightly tart taste, light bitter. Very interesting, tasty, and intensely drinkable brew.

Pours hazy amber with off white fluffy head. Aromas of sweeter citrus fruits, lots of funky brett, weak musty, pear, pine, rural, stable, straw and extremely fresh. Very nice.
